page.title: 08Landscape and Buildings
page.content: Viewed from the east shore the area presents a flat, gentle land/seascape, dotted with farms and cottages on the reclaimed land near the shoreline. On the eastern shoreline lies the hamlet of{Sandside}and the village of {Storth. } A good supply road follows the shoreline past Sandside. On it stands the Ship Inn, a builders supply merchant, a small printers shop and several private dwellings. The buildings are noted for the traditional use of water-worn limestone. Some houses have vertically-placed stones six or eight feet high, forming spectacular gate-posts. Older buildings are built entirely of limestone, though the newer ones tend only to be limestone rendered.
